conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sliders to find magnitude of external force F.
Slider A and B are on an inclined plane with angle 37 degrees, connected by a rope.
Slider B has a horizontal force F applied to the right.
Coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.5, maximum static friction equals kinetic friction.
Gravitational acceleration is g.
Gravitational force mg acts vertically downward on both sliders.
Normal force NA acts perpendicular to the inclined plane on slider A.
Frictional force fA acts up the incline on slider A.
Tension T in the rope acts up the incline on slider A.
Normal force NB acts perpendicular to the inclined plane on slider B.
Frictional force fB acts down the incline on slider B.
Tension T in the rope acts down the incline on slider B.
External force F acts horizontally to the right on slider B.
Resolve forces for slider A along incline: T = mg sin theta + fA.
Resolve forces for slider A perpendicular to incline: NA = mg cos theta.
Resolve forces for slider B along incline: F cos theta - T = mg sin theta - fB.
Resolve forces for slider B perpendicular to incline: NB = mg cos theta + F sin theta.
Known values: theta = 37 degrees, sin 37 degrees = 0.6, cos 37 degrees = 0.8, mu = 0.5.
Calculate normal force for slider A: NA = 0.8mg.
Calculate normal force for slider B: NB = 0.8mg + 0.6F.
Calculate frictional force for slider A: fA = 0.4mg.
Calculate frictional force for slider B: fB = 0.4mg + 0.3F.
Set up equation for tension for slider A: T = mg.
